attributes.action: Stop the BEASTING Punishment in the British Army
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Private Gavin Williams of the 2nd battalion Royal Welsh died on 3rd July 2006 as a result of an unofficial punishment exercise known in the British Armed forces as BEASTING. 

BEASTING is a term used in the British Armed forces which means if any soldier steps out of line they will be punished by way of extreme physical exercise until they are physically sick or fall to the floor in exhaustion and pain

MoD states clearly that in Military law.. "PHYSICAL EXERCISE SHOULD NOT BE USED AS A PUNISHMENT"

 
"Beasting is illegal and should not be condoned in today's British Army" 
(Adjutant General W.R.Rollo CBE)

 “The practice of beasting, which clearly falls outside appropriate military discipline, was going on openly and must have been known to senior officers.” (Mr Justice Royce)

BEASTING..
is a form of Bullying,Harrassment,Humiliation,Tortureand Ill-Treatment of an human being and should be stopped now before it happens again.

Our brave soldiers have enough to deal with without being sujected to various Bullying/Beasting punishments!

          STOP BEASTINGS NOW!
